isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - VISCOUS FAN DRIVES - REMOVE

note.para: On bi-metal fan drives, DO NOT remove (or tamper with) the bi-metal, the bracket, or the pin at the front of the drive. The locations of these mechanisms are critical, and preset for the life of the unit. Any tampering can cause loss of calibration and/or loss of viscous fluid from the housing.
DO NOT steam clean or use high pressure jets to clean the fan drive. This could force foreign material past the external seals, contaminating the viscous fluid, and causing the drive to malfunction.
Some spin-on fan drives are left hand thread.

step1.para: Remove the old fan drive from the engine shaft/water pump shaft.
Remove and retain the fan blades.
To remove the solenoid from a solenoid activated fan drive, refer to the procedures supplied with the solenoid replacement kit.
